subject: Psychology
title: Asch's Conformity Experiment
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Asch's Conformity Experiment.

hook.text: The answer is obviously line B. But everyone else says line C. You hesitate â€” then say C too.

buildup.text: In 1951, Solomon Asch tested whether people would conform to a group even when the group was clearly wrong.

discovery.text: 75% of participants conformed at least once. About a third conformed on most trials. The pressure was immense.

twist.text: When just one confederate broke from the group and gave the right answer, conformity dropped dramatically.

climax.text: We don't need a majority to resist. Just one dissenter can free everyone to think independently.

punchline.text: One honest voice can break the power of a crowd.

quiz.question: What did Asch's experiment demonstrate?
options: People conform to groups even when the group is clearly wrong
People always trust their own judgment
